Mini 1456: Revenge

Really, you feel sorry for him. You do. Being thrown in a river after being stabbed in the foot ten times and being suffocated by coins isn't really the best fate to befall a person. But whatever: his death means that you KNOW that someone's been arranging murders. Most of you would go meh and just carry on with your lives, but a few of you have decided to rise up and form a committee! Well, to be exact, 13 of you.
Of course, you say, the mafia would take advantage of this: they always do, being the cronies they are. And so an agreement was made: one person would be cast out of the town each day from the committee, in the rather silly hope that they would be a member of the local mafia.
Hey, good luck. You'll need it.
SoraAdvent, Town Governor has been killed Night 0.

RULES OF THE GAME:
Stolen I mean taken from Wraith:

1. Votes must be bolded, and be placed in the format Vote: Terra.
2. Days will have a deadline of two weeks. Deadline can be extended/shortened under certain circumstances, to my discretion.
3. Factions cannot talk during the day(i.e. mafia, neighbors, masons) unless specifically stated otherwise.
4. Do not, under any circumstances, communicate with a player outside the game thread regarding the game, unless specifically stated otherwise in your Role PM.
5. Do not, under any circumstances, quote any PM sent to you by me in the thread or otherwise.
6. Absolutely no invisible, small, or otherwise unreadable text. Spoiler tags are allowed as long as the nature of their contents are clearly labeled.
7. You will be prodded after failing to post in 48 hours. If you require a third prod you will instead be force-replaced. Please inform me in-thread of any upcoming V/LA in bold: V/LA Sunday to Saturday
-----7a. If you join this game and flake without posting or requesting a replacement you will be blacklisted, and not allowed to join any more of my games.
8. “Bah” posts are allowed, but can not include any kind of game-related information. However, lynched players may continue to talk during Twlight.
9. Twilight occurs after the hammer and before the lynch scene. You may continue to talk, but any new votes/unvotes will not be counted.
-----9a. "No Lynch" occurs when half of the remaining players vote for it.
10. Red is my color, don’t use it.
-----10a. Italics will be used in flavor.
11. I will use modkills at my discretion, with or without warnings depending on the severity offense. If you think something may break my rules (or patience), ask me first, or don’t do it at all. Modkills will either end the day or continue on(with the decision based on what is worse for the offender’s faction) and turn the killed player into a Neutral Survivor, thus making them lose.
12. If I make a mistake in some way, point it out by bolding a statement: @MOD: You made a mistake.
13. I reserve the right to add to or change the rules at my discretion. There are no loopholes, and I enforce ex post facto.
14. Don't be afraid to have fun. Despite the wording of these rules I am not a ruthless dictator and the vast majority of players are not trolls. Good luck!
-----14a. Also, please Be Civil. Please. Like, seriously, please.
15. Play to win. I don't care if someone you hate is in your faction: if you throw the game to spite someone or otherwise you will be modkilled and blacklisted.

On another note, I keep on saying otherwise.

Here's an example of the VT role PM, which you know will be given to at least one person:

Dawn breaks upon the first day after the Governor's(hint: that's me) death, and you all gather in the town hall to discuss the recent happenings. And by happenings, I mean my death, because this town isn't very productive...
What I find weird is that no one's attending the funeral of the person you're holding this committee for in the first place. But no matter: you people have better things to do.
So you all sit down, and you all just look at each other. You all look kinda normal. Some fat, some skinny, and then this one guy with no eyes at all, but sure, you all ask, how could anyone in here be part of the mafia?

"That's exactly what they want you to think, boys."

The place erupts into a riot, and you guys start shouting at each other while I sit here in the sky wondering why in the world the mafia would be so stupid as to be involved in this.


Day 1 begins. With 13 alive, it takes 7 to lynch, 6 to no lynch. Deadline is in two weeks from now: June 7th, at this post's hour. Good luck, have fun.

Also, Chevre and Chenoan are currently on V/LA.

Monkeyman has a fairly extensive catalogue of games where's he's been lynched D1, so I'm going to conduct a little bit of a meta analysis here.


The game I was originally thinking of that made me think it was unlikely that was Monkeyman was fakeclaiming was a long time ago, at the end of 2009: Mini 892. Here Monkey is lynched D1 as scum after fakeclaiming Cop when he reached L-1.

Prior to this, Monkey had actually been lynched D1 as a Cop twice in Mini 838 and Mini 795.

His first D1 lynch as a VT occurs in Mini 922 where he fakeclaims a PR D1, and then takes it back and trueclaims VT when he is on the precipice of being lynched.

Those games all happened within the 09-10 bracket, as he appeared to take a vacation from the site, and only regularly started playing mafia 2012, so we have two different patches of time I'm working with here.

--

Since 2012, Monkey has registered a few more D1 lynches. Frustratingly, none of those were as vanilla, as he appears to have a habit of being lynched as scum or a town PR.

Mini 1317 - Bodyguard
Mini 1382 - Mafia 2-Shot JoAT (claims JoAT)
Mini 1394 - Mafia Goon (claims VT)

--

Now, there's a lot of information there, and although we're missing a sample of VT claims, I've noticed a few interesting things.

Firstly, you can sort of see Monkey's understanding of escaping the noose develop. In his early games, he expresses the belief more than once about VT claims usually being disbelieved and lynched. I think this is the reason he went for the Cop fakeclaim in Mini 892. It's also the reason he decided to fake a powerrole as VT in Mini 922, as per his explanation here:

In post 568, MonkeyMan576 wrote:Oh, and I'm actually a vanilla townie. I lied because vanilla townie claims usually get lynched for being not useful anyways. I wasn't taking leads from Reck at all, and my flip will prove it. I wouldn't blame the town for lynching me because of the time left, but if you think you can get Sakuko or Lowell, especially, I would try.


This mindset seems prevalent in his early games. In his more recent games (1317 and 1382 specifically), his tactics seem to change a bit, where he softclaims a PR before he gets too many votes in 1317 and then claims once people wagon him for that. In 1382 he claims without someone declaring intent to hammer - just as soon as the sixth vote comes down. This seems a lot more survival-based, and ultimately neither claim work.

If it just stopped there, this would appear like decent evidence that Monkey is town, indicating that as scum he's a lot more likely to try and fakeclaim a PR to escape the D1 lynch, but it seems like he's figured out that doesn't always work and sometimes a VT claim is more convincing. In 1394, his most recent 'lynched D1 game', he pulls out a VT claim as scum.

To me, the sample here is probably inconclusive - it appears Monkey's ideology is shifting, as he's developing a more nuanced approach to D1 claiming, so it seems foolish to make reads off this information.

HOWEVER, the other thing I noticed that appears to have a much stronger correlation over time is that Monkey throwing out vague threats or half-assed accusations as scum when he claims. For example;

Fakeclaiming as Mafia JoAT in 1382 and as Mafia Goon in 1394:

In post 152, MonkeyMan576 wrote:I'm the town jack of all trades.

Right now my top scumreads are Empking and Johhog.

Notch is right that their argument is stupid, but everything around that argument reeks of scum.

In post 320, MonkeyMan576 wrote:I'm a vanilla townie. Lynch me at your own risk.


Does that second one seem familiar? (Hint: Look at post 287 in this game)

Even in the game where he's faking a PR as a VT, he uses the same tactic:

In post 471, MonkeyMan576 wrote:I'm a Jack of all Trades you'd better not lynch me...


Whereas, in games as Cop or his Bodyguard game, he usually just goes "Well, I'm the Cop" as does nothing after the claim. No threats or accusations. When he trueclaims Bodyguard in 1317 game he's very stoic and even apologetic.

--

I think the most convincing thing is the word for word replica of his fakeclaim in 1394. I'm willing to hammer him on that alone, and the other evidence while less conclusive hints at a pattern that is supportive or at least doesn't refute my beliefs. As an aside, I noticed Monkey tended to be more overarching and absolute in his reads and accusations as scum - this is something I thought was weird early in the game when he claimed I was town. That fits with the meta I picked up on when skimming his games.

I'll give everyone the final word to nitpick this before I hammer, just in case someone has other opinions about what's going on here.

Nothing. That's right, you value your sleep more than anything else.
~~~~
That crazy preacher dude who called himself a Zionite looked up into the sky. He wasn't asleep, though he knew(more like thought, since he's wrong) that everyone else was sleeping.

"Why am I here in the first place? Is there a goal to this life?"

Just as he asked a question, a letter floated in.

It said this:
"Dear Zionite,
I know full well that you have been searching for life's goal. Part of the reason why you have not received the truth is because you have been tested time and time again, and have proven to be successful.
However, there is another reason why you have not seen it as of yet. There is the impending matter of your reluctance to come to terms with your own life and your death. But the way I see it, there is only one final test before you find life’s goal.

It’s easy: just leave this town. That’ll show how determined you are. And once you’ve left town, you’ll find what you want waiting for you.

Yours sincerely,
A. Knox.”

Zionite looked around, noticing no one else was there. He quickly scribbled down a note, and then left the town forever, in search of a new life.
~~~~
There was a kid who went by the name of Keybladewielder, but everyone just called him KBW, for laziness or whatever.

This guy was brash, he was rash, but nevertheless looked as innocent as he could be. Who would think he was scum?

Well, he did decide to attend that crazy meeting after all. Everyone called him crazy, everyone called him scum.

And then while he was walking home, he got dunked into the river. He didn’t even see it coming, the poor kid. Over, and over, and over, and over, and over, and over, and over, and over.

He drowned sooner or later, the poor kid.
~~~~
The town awoke to see Zionite's note and KBW's disappearance, but they strolled on. Arguments fly, arguments soar, and then they fall while everyone goes off randomly voting for people until majority vote takes the reigns and kills another person.

Whoop de doo.


Zionite, who was a Vanilla Townie, has disappeared forever(killed) Night 1.
Keybladewielder, who was a Vanilla Townie, has been dunked in teh river(killed) Night 1.

Day 2 begins. Deadline is in two weeks from now: 20th June, at this post's hour, GMT+8 and whatever.

I'm suspicious of Chevre for reasons you mentioned earlier in the game. He tends to be narrating the game as opposed to offering any meaningful analysis or insight - that's a fairly reliable scumtell in my eyes. I'm suspicious of Elyse and Chenoan too, but this is largely from process of elimination. Here is how I am seeing the game right now:

mario and luigi: town. Players like this can't be read in the traditional sense - he is literally on a different plane of existence as far as I'm concerned. The only meaningful insight I've gleaned from his posts is what I talked about in post 134. Amongst the nonsense, it makes no sense for him to air concerns about lynching a townie in that manner as scum. It's irrational, but it's town irrationality.

Diabolik: town. Like mario, I'm pretty sure he is town based on his unsolicited claim. Two-shot vig is a role the Normal Review Group like to use in Mini Normals. How could he pick up on this metagame subtlety? It's obvious to me he is not at this level of awareness, as evidenced by the fact he thought there was a night 0 this game. It would have to be a pretty lucky fluke to claim a role that syncs up with Mini Normal meta so well. Occams Razor: it's way more likely that this actually is his role.

jmo16mla: town. I explained my read on the jmo situation yesterday and my thoughts haven't changed. Admittedly my whole town read on him hinges on his claim, but I think that's the most illuminating piece of evidence for his alignment. Too often I've seen people play like jmo as town, that his overall behaviour comes second to his claim.

Nul: town. In the midst of town apathy and mindless play, Nul has stood up over and over to drive the game forward. He has been logical and active, and while these aren't always town qualities, his reads tend to sync up with mine, and I think his cases have been made in good faith. If he's scum, we're fucked, but this is a pretty low-percentage chance in my mind, so I'm pretty much ignoring this outcome when there are better targets still alive.

~~

MonkeyMan576 - Chenoan, jmo16mla, Keybladewielder, Zionite, Chevre, mario and lugi, Hoopla
enomis - Diabolik
Chenoan - Nul
Keybladewielder - ac1983fan, Elyse, MonkeyMan576
ac1983fan - enomis


The majority of the Monkey wagon is town or is my town read, something fairly damning for Chevre and Chenoan. I find it unlikely that the entire wagon was town. About 18 months ago, I researched Day 1 wagons on town in Mini Normals and over 50 games only two games featured zero scum on the lynch wagon. The majority of cases were two scum, with three scum the next most likely outcome.

I'm not always keen on using probabilistic reasoning like this, but given the wagon was largely reasonless drivel until I placed my hammer, it tarnishes my view of the motivation for the wagon. When a culture of weak or underwhelming votes are tolerated when joining a wagon, it's more likely that scum are okay with abusing the privilege. The Monkey wagon was sloppy and easy to join - there was scum on it.

Given my previous reads, I'm definitely in favour of lynching Chevre or Chenoan. I'm going to dump my vote on Chevre until I read up more on Chenoan as well as enomis/ac1983/Elyse. I think the scumteam is within these five players.

The night was silent - a stifling silence that gets right under your skin and shakes you to the core. There isn't any rest for a man on a night like tonight. Wearing the darkness like a clock, Ankamius decided to go for a midnight stroll. As he approached the street corner, he saw a group under the lightpost.

"Ah, I see you chaps are as restless as I. Mind if I join you?"

"Not at all."

~~~~

It always seems to be at the most inopportune of times that Ankamius had stopped to reflect upon the set of events that brought him to the present. How frusturating. It is maddening to run through a set of events, seeing every circumstance and decision that was made, and realize that the conclusion would have been the same no matter what. How could he have known that a calm walk through the local woods was really a calculated divergence from the beaten path? What could he have done when the knife sank into his back? The stony face of determination and rage on his good friend - were there warning signs? No. They had hidden it well. There was nothing he could do then and nothing he could do now, as he lay cold and dying. But...maybe there was? If he could just write the name - he coul....he c...

The night was silent.

Javier Michael O'Connor never had it easy. I mean, just look at that name. Imagine the amount of bullying he went through as a child. After such a tough upbringing and with clearly sadistic parents, he never had much of a chance. It wasn't long before he turned to a life of crime.

On this particular day, though, his time was up. Cornered and with nowhere to go, JMO leapt forward and pulled a bloody knife from his jacket. Ducking, a member of the town kicked the knife out of his hand and sent it flying. With a murderous cry, JMO leapt after the knife only to turn around and find a gun in his face.

"Don't move. Just give it up - no one else has to die today."

Glancing frantically from side to side, JMO examined his options. He sighed. He had none. Well, that wasn't quite true. He could still choose whether or not to face the rope. The knife in his hands sunk into his stomach and his guts spilled onto the ground.

The detective known only as Nul was onto something. These killings - they had things in common. If he could piece together the threads, then he could find the murderers and save the town.

With that in mind, he wandered down to the local pub. All times are drinking times when a detective is on a case like this. The way that JMO kid had stabbed himself - that type of stuff shakes even the strongest of men. As Nul walked into the pub, he didn’t notice the person who had been following him for the last three blocks.

~~~~

Time to get back to work. The trip to the pub wasn’t entirely for pleasure. The owner was a mine of information if given the right monetary incentives. Nul was directed to the alley behind JMO’s house as a place of interest. The bullet that made contact with his knee when he got there was less than expected.

“The owner of that pub doesn’t take sides. He takes money. Did you really think you could outspend the mafia? That was your second of two strikes. Your first strike was ever investigating this at all. So, as I see it, you have one more strike to give. Answer me this: are you done with your investigation?”

Nul whimpered as he accepted his fate. He was a lot of things, but a coward wasn’t one of them. Maybe his death would help the town find the culprits responsible for this spree of killings. Nul closed his eyes.

“Pity.”

BANG!

For those who live by the gun, die by the gun.
~~~~
The seedy-looking man known as Scott didn't trust anyone of them fools. He would keep quiet, and let his trusty pistol do the talkin'. After all, if you have two bullets, you get to exact your own form of justice, right?

Yeah, but even he didn't see the trap placed in front of him. Scott thought he had cornered the man, and was just about to get a shot off when a million things happened at once. The man knocked the gun out of his hand, caught it, and aimed it straight at his head. Scott saw the little black circle in front of him, and it was almost like a foretelling sign of death.

Scott caught his insidious look, a greedy smile. He knew that he had made a mistake, but no matter: his legacy would be carried on in the hearts of his fellow teammates. Even as he waited for the inevitable shot, he knew that justice would be delivered. It just had to.
~~~~
If you thought you saw dangerous, you haven't seen anything yet.
